page.title: 15Employment.
page.content: Water Pumping Station. Milborne St. Andrew is situated in a valley on chalk downland. Under neath the village is a large natural lake. The Wessex Water Authority have built a small pumping station that is automatic on the Milton Abbas road, to the north of the village. This supplies the local Express factory with the required water supply. The village water comes from another valley to the North West of the village where there is another small pumping station at the village of Dewlish. The water is very 'hard'. Through the centre of Milborne Valley runs a small stream each Spring time and continues to run throughout the Summer depending on rainfall, and the height of the water table and the underground lake.
